content:
As an AI language model, I cannot predict the future, but I can speculate on how the pandemic might impact the long-term performance of Liga I teams, especially their ability to attract international talent.

The pandemic is likely to have a significant impact on the long-term performance of Liga I teams. The financial strain caused by canceled matches and lost revenue is likely to make it harder for clubs to invest in talent development and acquisition. This may impact the quality of play in the league, which could make it harder for clubs to maintain their competitiveness at the domestic and international levels.

Furthermore, the restrictions on travel and the uncertainty caused by the pandemic may make it harder for Liga I teams to attract international talent. Players and their agents may be hesitant to relocate to countries with high rates of infection or countries with uncertain economic prospects.

However, it is possible that the situation will improve in the near future, allowing for a more stable environment to attract international talent. Additionally, the use of advanced analytics and scouting technology may help Liga I teams discover and recruit hidden talent despite the challenges posed by the pandemic. Overall, the pandemic will create new challenges for Liga I teams, but innovative and creative solutions may help them maintain their long-term competitiveness.
